intro: Monardella odoratissima var. australis, commonly known as the western sweet peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its overall aromatic qualities. This variety is known for its fragrance and is sometimes used in traditional herbal practices.
